Expand button
Available in the horizontal variants, a tap on the expand button
(top right corner) can be bound to any action. Ideally it should be
used to display a larger version of the card to make scanning
easier.

Behaviours
A tap on the expand button can trigger
any action
The expand button triggers an action that can be used to display
a secondary view of the card in a larger format. This secondary
view can be a modal, a page, or any other type of view. It is
ultimately defined by each product team on implementation.
0
The main use case for this component is scanning a Member Card number at the retail
point of sale when it is displayed on the customer's mobile device.
Don't change the styling of elements
All Member Cards are already customised for the existing programs at IKEA. Changing
the visual design of these cards by applying different styles to elements will create
deviations from the identity of each program and might even compromise the ability of
the card to be scanned properly.
The code graphics should appear in black on a white background in order to ensure
that the scanning process is quick and hassle free.
The card image should be displayed as large as possible, but within standard design
guidelines.
IKEA Family IKEA Family

@ Use the card with the customisations provided. © Don't change the colour of elements.
Provide the expand button when necessary
When the card is displayed horizontally on a mobile screen, the smaller size or
resolution of the code might make scanning difficult.
In these cases, the expand button can be displayed on the card to allow the user to view
it in a larger format.
The expand button triggers an action that can be used to display a secondary view of
the card in a larger format. This secondary view can be a modal, a page, or any other
type of view. It is ultimately defined by each product team on implementation.

Increase the screen brightness
When displaying the Member Card in a native IKEA app, the brightness can be
increased automatically by the app. This behaviour is recommended.
Scanning a graphical code from the screen of a mobile device works better if the
brightness is increased on the device displaying the card.
Isolate the card on a screen that is triggered by an action from the user. When the
action is triggered, simultaneously display the card and increase the screen brightness.
Return the screen's brightness to its previous state when the user dismisses the view.
The brightness control is shown below for illustrative purposes only. It is not necessary
to display this control.

Internationalisation
RTL languages
Member Cards should flip their orientation and content for RTL
languages. In the horizontal orientation, the code is shown on
the left and the text is aligned to the right.
